review_title: Not all that Glitters is Gold
pros: Free training, rewarding work, decent benefits, free addiction supervision, mostly nice coworkers. Decent pay and benefits.
cons: Upper management is not trustworthy. There is extreme turnover among the therapy staff and there are no counselors at Fellowship Hall that have been employed for more than 6 years at most. The vast majority of clinicians have been there four or less years. Free meals have been taken away to save money. Favoritisms run rampant and staff are treated unequally. Management does not care about their employees and they keep leaving. It’s like rats trying to get off a sinking ship. Company keeps asking staff to donate money, yet annual merit raises are not guaranteed. Clinical leadership is the worst at any organization I’ve ever worked for in my career.
Minimal upper mobility; no benefits for less than 30hr employees
